Reviews.Title: “clean, great location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Danni D
Reviews.Content: I booked very short notice and decided on the River Park Hotel & Suites despite the bad reviews, mainly because it was the cheapest option still available and in a good location. I have to say I was positively surprised. The receptionist was very nice and gave us great recommendations on what to do and where to eat. When I mentioned that we were going on a cruise he remembered another couple staying at the hotel who was going on the same cruise and he arranged for us to meet and share a taxi to the port. We made cruise friends before even going on our cruise! Of course it's no 5* hotel but our room and bathroom were big, nicely furnished and clean, which is the most important thing for me. The location is great! You can easily go anywhere in Miami. The only thing that could have been better is the breakfast which consisted of do-it-yourself bagels, fruit loops and the like. But I didn't even expect there to be any breakfast so I wasn't really upset about that. The receptionist gave us great breakfast recommendations, so just ask them! - and please don't be rude and complain about them having a slight accent like the people checking in before us did! just because they grew up bilingual/with another mother tongue doesn't mean that they are bad at their jobs. The maid was so surprised when I first greeted her in the hallway and wished her a good morning, it really made me sad.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: TheChipperCupcake
Reviews.Content: Got there and it was better than I expected. It is not the cleanest place, but the bed was clean and the bathroom was clean. The rest of the room I did not want to touch that much. It really needs a good cleaning and painting and it would be fine. The one BIG DOWNER was that you cannot control the temperature from your room and we both froze!!! I mean my husband actually got up in the middle of the night to put layers. The location is great and we felt safe walking to the bay. It has a little beach and there are plenty of great places to eat! Would stay again for location but would not stay more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “never got to check in”
Reviews.Author: MsLauraHC
Reviews.Content: Because of delayed planes, my boyfriend called about 7 pm to be sure our reservation was still good and that someone would be at the desk to check us in when our plane finally arrived. The front desk assured everything was fine. When we got to the hotel about 2 a.m., a group of people were berating the clerk. We stopped feeling sorry for him as soon as we realized these people had a pre-paid reservation but not a room (actually 4 rooms for 14 people). We felt even less sorry for him when he informed us that we also had no room. Other properties owned by the same company were less than helpful about finding space for us. In fact, one man laughed and, when asked for his name, hung up on us. When the Miami PD walked in I was afraid we were in trouble for arguing with the clerk, but it turned out that this hotel has done this before and the police officers were there to help us. Thanks to Miami's finest, we finally got rooms at different hotels (seriously, the same places we called who had no rooms did find room when asked by uniformed officers. Go figure!). Now that I see reviews, I feel lucky we didn't get our room. P.S. next I book the rooms--and only after I read trip advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zeventien
Reviews.Content: This was probably a great hotel once upon a time. Now it's a relatively cheap stay in downtown Miami. It's clean, the breakfast makes you laugh and there is wifi. Rooms are worn down but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Way too much money for what we got”
Reviews.Author: PatGreenville
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this hotel. Positive: no problem with front desk staff (except they don't answer the phone and no wake-up calls). They were helpful as far as they could be. Blow dryer didn't work - was replaced same day. Room was dark and quiet. Bed was comfortable. Close to metromover. Negatives: no blanket on bed - just sheet and bedspread (& we all know we don't want those near our bodies); walls were filthy; no coffee machine; no hot water in shower for 2 days out of 4; toilet wouldn't flush; sink backed up; carpet was filthy; had to have key re-keyed 3 times to get in room; only get 1 room key; nasty all-carb, all-sweet breakfast; breakfast started at 8 so cldn't even get coffee! business people are gone long before that. guess it's cheaper that way?; only 1 elevator worked 3 days out of 4; no internet access in room; lousy lighting in room; bottom drawer fell apart when I opened it; don't walk on carpet with bare feet; obligatory safe fee of $2/day; no hand towels - bath towels and one face cloth; no printer at computer downstairs (altho desk staff printed off our boarding passes for us). A total rip-off for $220 with tax per night through hotels.com!!!!!! We might have endured all of the above except for the ridiculous price. We feel totally ripped off by both the hotel and hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay only”
Reviews.Author: all_I_want_is_sun
Reviews.Content: For where this hotel is and the location you would think it would be a classy place. Sorry to say not so much! We stayed for one night before going on a cruise the next day. The reason we chose this hotel was for the location. It is centrally located to everything. Our check in was slow and the reservation clerk was rude. Our room well lets put it this way as I walked through the door my first reaction was really...room smelled musty, the bathroom door had the towel hook ripped off with a hole in the door, and the bedspread and a stain on it Yuck. We had a great view of a cement wall. The continental breakfast was pathetic powder donuts, sugar cereal, bagels from probably a corner store. This hotel disappointed us with being where it is. However if you are looking for a cheaper accomodation for one night this hotel will do for one night only.

Reviews.Title: “great location next to metro to get around the downtown”
Reviews.Author: Donna934
Reviews.Content: Yes the price is very right. The location is great, because you walk right out front door and there is the people mover metro. Yes, some of the front desk staff are not such people oriented, but for a no frill low cost huge suites with great bathroom, it is a bargain. Our group has stayed there for or conference the last 8 years.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad... great location”
Reviews.Author: Namaste24
Reviews.Content: well.. for weeks i read the reviews and wondered if i do it or not. I had called the hotel a few times to ask questions and yes staff was rude or sometimes no one answered but it was the only place under 120$ and it was just one night. I kept thinking i made a bad decision but the location is excellent. YOu walk out and go right all the way and you are by water at bayside and its walking to alot of shopping especially to Macys and tons of electronic stores. Yes check in was long as I had to ask if they had my reservation and then the agent finally said he didnt. Finally we checked in, 5th floor, big room and no bugs, no dirty sheets or towels as i read. Yes this place needs to be renovated big time but if they renovate the price will jump. For one night its fine. Yes they take a copy of the credit card, Yes they charge 2.$ for a safe even if u dont use it (we sure did) Yes its true there are no Kleenex boxes. I found the room noisy because i was on the street side- the back is quieter and has a great view of the little river where boats pass. The room was clean and the there was a second area with just a couch and sink plus a 2nd door and there were 2 tvs. The location is super and the hotel offers a shuttle to the port for 6$ per person but patience is needed. Check out is at 11am or they charge you extra and continental breakfast was fine. No complaints on this. One night only.

Reviews.Title: “so-so hotel, but suspect credit card practices”
Reviews.Author: Becky_the_Cat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay if you want something reasonably priced in the heart of the business district of Miami. It borders the river community of condos. Location is really great. I stayed here and was relatively happy with my experience. However: I now live in Miami and want to talk about another experience I had regarding their credit card practice. I reserved a room through booking.com for a relative who was looking to possibly stay there, but she later changed her mind. I cancelled the reservation WELL in advance (10 days), and received a confirmation email regarding the cancellation. Nonetheless, a full day's charge shows up in my credit card statement. If you want to stay here, lodger beware! Comb through your credit card statement with hawk's eyes before and after your stay--or pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bushwick2002
Reviews.Content: Check in/out was a bit longer then other hotels. they also make a photo copy of your credit card. This hotel uses key cards for the room which is a plus. There are ants all over the place; In the bedroom, bathroom sink, hallway, cheap dining restaurant. Hotel swimming pool is really small and not very clean. during my 4 night stay, I did not see anybody swim in it. The free breakfast buffet is a joke. mostly bagels, bowl of ceral, milk, orange juice that upsetted my stomach 2 days in a row. after that, we just went out to get breakfast. There is wifi in the guest room on the first floor. Ice machines on 5th and 7th floor. Room safe costed $2+ per night. I would not really recommend this place. however the bed did feel clean enough to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “The door to Mystery”
Reviews.Author: r8402
Reviews.Content: Went to spend New Year's in Miami with a friend, and to watch the Orange Bowl Game. The week of going to be in Miami, we were searching for hotels, and wanted to stay in downtown. Reading lots of the horror story reviews of this hotel, we both were apprehensive about booking a stay there. One of the reviews which still sticks with me is that housekeepers steal clothes from the rooms, and nothing was done about it. Check in was fine. Once we checked in the room, it had an odd musty odor. We quickly got ready to enjoy a night out on the town for NYE celebration. Upon returning to the room around 4:00 a.m., I noticed there was no "Do Not Disturb" sign, and the door had no lock! No security chain, or dead bolt. Meaning, hotel staff members could come and go as they pleased in our room. I pulled back my sheets, and there was what I dubbed "the mystery spot." It smelled like feces, and the bed was visably wet. We called the front desk, and they said there was nothing they could do about it. I ended up sleeping on the foot of the bed to avoid being on the wet spot. Around 3:00 p.m. I heard a noise. I thought it was my friend in the restroom, and my friend says to me loud "Hey, trying to sleep off my hang over. Keep it down!" I tell him "...That isn't me making the noise." We both sit up in bed, and see the light on in the restroom, and the door ajar. A housekeeper comes out, and we look at each other. I told her "No service please." She responded in spanish "I don't speak English." Lucky my friend spoke fluent spanish, and told her we didn't need the restroom clean, and told her about the wet spot on my bed. She rolled her eyes, walked over to the spot, and she says "Your friend probably vomited in his sleep. That's what this is." He told her that the bed was like that when we got back from the club. She insisted that it was my fault. She stepped on my white shirt I had worn out, and she said "Sorry" and picked it up. "Oops" she said in English, and my shirt was now that brown color of the mystery spot. She touched the carpet, and it was wet also. I hadn't noticed that when we checked in, because it was on the side of the bed. I walk over near the housekeeper, and the musty smell was overwhelming. It smelled like urine. We called the front desk and asked to be moved to another room, but according to the hotel, they had "no rooms available," and the room we booked was only available on that floor. I was really upset about her getting my white shirt stained, and there was not even a "Let me wash your shirt sir" or anything. She made my bed, just put three matress pads, two towels, then the cover sheet over the wet spot. She said to my friend "I put enough layers on it, so it shouldn't soak through." Needless to say I went to the front desk and raised hell about it. The only staff member Guillermo (goes by english version of his name "Will" or "William) apologized. I said I was very upset the housekeeper was so blunt and implied it was my fault. I asked about the no locks on the door, and the female co-worker of his said only suites have the do not disturb sign and dead bolt/security chain. After going out to dinner and exploring Miami, we returned to the room to get ready for another fun night out. I had noticed my suitcase was partially unzipped, because a sleeve of one of my shirts was sticking out. I started to panic. I knew what was had happen. Perhaps out of spite, the housekeeper didn't like my comment to her from earlier in the day, and returned after we left and took two more pairs of my white shirts. I called the front desk, and demanded to talk to the manager, or someone of higher authority. Nothing was done!! I ended up going to a store to buy some more white shirts, and locks for my luggage. My friend did the same also. He was lucky and nothing was stolen from him. This hotel is just for sleeping only. Don't expect anything fancy. The ONLY nice person on staff was Guillermo. Other comments. I wrote post cards, and there was a outgoing mail bin at the front desk. I put my cards in there, and the woman took them out and gave it back to me. "Sorry, for hotel staff only." What a b*itch! As I was leaving the hotel to head to the airport, Guillermo asked what happen, I told him. His face got red with angry. He apologized, and said he would gladly send my postcards off in the mail. He went back inside, and I could see him getting into an argument with the woman. He came back out, and apologized for her actions. When I had stayed there in January, only one of the elevators worked. They do have a very outdated computer near the elevator for guest to use. It was so slow, and outdated, it couldn't load sites like google maps, or mapquest. If you're looking for a cheap room, then stay here, but be cautioned! I only gave the service a "Average" rating, because of how nice Guillermo was in handling our needs. He booked us a tour of the Everglades, always greeted us and other guest in respectful manners. Anyone else, were rude. The pool was closed, even though it was in the 70's and humid on some days. The view we had from our room was nice. The AC didn't work either. TV stations came and went. Some days ESPN would work, other days it came in snowy. Hotel is in a "okay" location. Was hard to get a cab there. We didn't have a car, we stayed on foot. About a 10 minute walk to American Airlines Arena, and the Bayside Mall.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE FRONT DESK STAFF”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravlere
Reviews.Content: Customer service is non-existent here. Bonyda at the front desk is very rude and there was only one bellman and the two of them seem to be the only full-time employees after 3:00 pm. The hotel is dirty and smells. The Hyatt is only a couple of miles from this hotel and was only $40 more per night. We moved to they Hyatt and it was 1000% better!

Reviews.Title: “Definitivamente regresarÃ­a”
Reviews.Author: Alice R
Reviews.Content: Es una excelente opciÃ³n si lo que buscas es nada mÃ¡s dormir. Muy buena ubicaciÃ³n, el servicio de los empleados del Lobby fue muy bueno, en especial de Guillermo. Hay muy buen ambiente. Definitivamente lo recomiendo. Limpio, seguro, centrico y cÃ³modo.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: ramluap
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and they had lost my reservation. I had to resend the email they sent me.Took two hours to sort out. The hotel stank of disinfectant. Condition of the room was poor. The hotel needs refurbishing. Location was good. The ice machine only worked on 5th and 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor management, very dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Ensjuneau
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids spend two nights at this hotel after a cruise vacation. The hotel floor plan is nice but it lacks good customer service. Very dirty rooms (carpet, floors, counters). Housekeeping staff will make your bed and give you clean towels but that is it. The location is very good. I would not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Renovation time!”
Reviews.Author: Wayako
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights last May (2011) and really had no complaints or bad experiences. The room was large, including a VERY large bathroom, clean, and everything worked. The continental breakfast was minimal but adequate for a few days' stay. Great location and low prices. The basic problem with this hotel is that it needs a makeover very badly; everything is quite worn and showing its age. But for the money, there probably isn't a better hotel deal in downtown Miami. Again, no bugs, stains, rude people - never encountered any of these so have no idea what these other reviewers are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction & Value”
Reviews.Author: EVELINA-POUPEE
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a smile and friendliness upon our arrival. The staff informed us that they would be of service to us for setting up tours, transportation or anything else. Our AC did not work. We found this out after we had unpacked. The management offer us another room, but we did not want to move and unpack again, so they provided us with a satisfactory substitute, a powerful fan. The location of this hotel was fantastic. Where walking would be tiresome there were buses and the free MetroMover to get us around. The hotel prices gave is value. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. We had a nice view of the Miami River. The complimentary breakfast was good; bagels, cereal, pastries, milk, orange juice and coffee. I have no idea why there are so many negative reviews of this wondefil hotel. We have been here twice before, but only 11 and 2the days respectively to catch a cruise and a connecting flight. This was our first extended stay at the River Park. We enjoyed our 6-dayfirst stay there and would most definitely go there again and highly recommend it to others. Internet access was free of charge in the lobby. We had everything we could have wanted at a very good price. Thank you River Park Hotel &Suites Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: lloyd T
Reviews.Content: Mid July 2011, wife and I had booked online for this hotel. Got there the reception was nothing to write home about. However, got our key went upstairs 4th floor. enter door horrible odor hit us in the face and a big ugly stain on the rug said HELLO! Took a brave chance and rest our luggage on the floor--horrid back down stairs to see the receptionist. Ask her if she could have someone remove the stain and change the bed linen-- she said yes. we went to have dinner at a nearby restaurant, was very hungry and tired all day travelling lots of flights jet-log. Got back to the hotel took elevator upstairs enter room. "HELLO AGAIN," the ugly stain on the floor said to us. Pulled the bed linen back sniff the pillow. My wife said LETS GET OUT OF HERE! Grab our luggage went back to the receptionist desk- had to wait because another couple was arguing with her. We overheard the conversation and they wanted to get the hell out of there fast. I slipped outdoor just before the couple hop in the awaiting taxi. ask the gentleman what was that all about he said the place is absolutely disgusting and they can't stay there. This is like after mid night now. I handed the key to the receptinist she handed me another key. We went back upstairs open the door--much bigger room but BAM--another slap in the face by a terrible ODOR. My wife and I just made and b-line and handed the key back to the receptionist. Bear with me the story gets even better. We went out door of the lobby there was this lady standing outside with her luggage at her feet. We greeted her and struck up a conversation only to find out that she had already spent three nights there and she had one more night left but she had to go because she cannot take another nightmare in this hotel from hell. on top of all that she showed us two BED BUGS that she is saving as proof. Never seen bed bug in my life. We didn't get our money back yet. Anyway, we booked into another hotel to finish up the night--a four star hotel this time.

Reviews.Title: “distgusting hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: linzi c
Reviews.Content: we stopped here in september and my god absouluty horrible and disgusting we had our boy with us who is nearly 4 and he even said get me out of this cacking hotel , and the staff were just a joke we had to get out of there a.s.a.p so we managed to do so we couldnt sleep there the door wasn,t even secure it was a dump and a dive never experienced anything like it , i mean looked out of the window and the pool was like a tin bath it was outragous !!!! i wouldnt even think what you had for breakfast my god would have been poision!!!!! we managed to go to another hotel about ten mins in taxi the marriott. on bayshore drive now that was class. so i would not reccommend this hotel absoulute so bad oh and i forgot about the smell it was like foisty air fresher trying to cover up the horrible stench.? do not stop here unless you are mad.

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend it people on the front disk are rude specially the lady with the red hair blue eyes and braces”
Reviews.Author: Odinazer
Reviews.Content: There was a lady with a red hair and blue eyes working in the front office she was so rude can you imagine she was eating here nails in front of the clients with that ugly braces ukk The hotel was so cheap but they charged us 2 dollar each nightfor a safe box it was mandatory rooms was not bad but there was no fridge the asked for 20 dollars each night for an additional bed ooh yea people on the front disk treated us like Maids service poor I couldn't find even sugar for my coffee.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very conveniently, quite close to the beaches. I stayed on the 15th floor for two nights and the view was spectacular. The hotel personal was helpful, specially the gentleman at the reception. Also, the price I paid was fine compared to other options I had. I would not hesitate to stay here again whenever I am back in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great loacation but poor service and standars. . . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: porter1307
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for about 6 days, the hotel looks 10,000 times better than in the pics that have online thab how it really looks. . . .the staff was friendly but not that professional . The room was ok had everything you need but in very . . . .our room had some stains in the walls. We had a room on floor 15 it had a really cool view. The pool does not look that good but we jumped in and it reallyh hepled with the intense heat that you feel in MIAMI.. . . . The break fast menu is just not good, all they have is ceral juice and bagels. . . . .I will not stay in this hotel again. . . The location just perfect everything intersting is less thant 15 minutes way. . . .if you don't mind staying in a very old hotel with friendly but unprofessional staff you shuld book thos hotel and still have a good time. . .

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book a Room at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EAJ03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in deplorable condition. Smells Old as if it hasn't thoroughly been cleaned in quite a number of years. The only thing about it is that it is in a good location. Spend a few more dollars and stayed at the Hyatt that is about 20 feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it, we are never coming back”
Reviews.Author: Dukati2011
Reviews.Content: 1. The employees were so rude and un - professional, front desk making personal calls in front of clients. 2. no hot water in our room, the water was luke warm 3. The breakfast was terrible, the food was so limited 4.We were there for 7days and we had to request for house keeping, the towels we got usually were stained (disgusting) 5.communication barrier, majority speak spanish and dont really care that you speak english 6.No hotel car parking for its guest, if you want to park on the side you pay $18 7.The hotel bar played really loud spanish music, you actually think you are walking into a night club. 8.Nobody showers when jumping into the pool, because the shower doesnt work, you can imagine the dirt in there. 9.We asked to speak to the manager and we were told he was busy.Nobody cares about pleasing the client. 10.The hotel rooms have NO fridge, the TV is outdated, majority of the channels are in spanish, the walls and the carpet gees!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheets were really uncomfortable and rough.”
Reviews.Author: Blueberrysprite
Reviews.Content: First off, i had to wait in no line for 12 min for front desk to tell me to give them a moment to help me. An then a man in unifrom who was at the door ask me to take a seat an wait while no one was at the front desk cause the 2 people that were there went into a room behined the desk and closed the door. Then when they finally came out a person who has just arrived walk in and started helping them while forgetting that they ask me to wait. Which I did for about a total time since I walked in 20 mins. The sheets were really rough and itchy. The movie pay selection on the tv never worked. I ALSO found a rotting orange in a corner of the room behinde the curtain. The maid service was supposed to bring us clean towels and brought it 3 hours later while I had already ended up taking my shower. The young maid tryed to force her self into the room each time she came to our door WITHOUT asking.The hotel keys weren't working and we had to go down stairs everytime we wanted to re enter our room.last day elevator broke

Reviews.Title: “Good location but curt staff”
Reviews.Author: AKMittal
Reviews.Content: Riverpark Hotel & Suites, Miami, Florida: Good location but curt staff. We stayed at the hotel for the night of June 13. We arrived at the hotel at about 10 A.M. whereas the check in time was 3.00 P.M. We were told that early check-in would cost USD 30.00. However, we could check at about 12.00 whether a room is available. We asked whether we could leave our baggage. We were told that would be USD 2 per bag. We sat down in the lobby to connect the internet and plan our day. There was trouble getting connected, the hotel staff could not provide any help. We managed to get connected after a long persistent trial with different alternatives. The hotel lobby had a large number of discount coupons and travellogues nicely displayed. It was 11.30 by the time we figured out what we could do during the day. We enquired again about the availability of room and were told that the room would be available in about half an hour. We decided to wait. A person came and told us that the room was ready and we could check-in. The lady at the reception, however, said that the room was still not ready and that we will have to wait for a few minutes more. This 'wait for a few .more minutes' continued for acouple of hours and we could check-in only at about 2.30 P.M. In contrast to the sparkling lobby area, the elevators had a very worn out look. The room was also not very clean and had some broken tiles. There was no refrigerator in the room. Wi-Fi connectivity was available only in the lobby A free metromover is available in Miami downtown. The metromover station was right across the hotel giving easy access to all attractions in the downtown area. All the markets in the vicinity were closed, probably because it was a Monday. THe place had a deserted look by 9.00 P.M which we did not expect in a city like Miami. The hotel was a disappointment specially after receiving excellent hospitality earlier in a hotel on Miami Beach and on board a cruise liner. We wish the staff was a little more polite,courteous and responsible. Location and low tariff would still probably make it worth staying in the hotel for a low budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “the whole hotel experience was disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: mariag020
Reviews.Content: this hotel seems ok once you first walk in, but the front desk people are rude!! they charge for the safe even if you don't use it! we got our key and went up to the room and it was disgusting the whole hotel has a funny smell the room had stains all over the carpet and walls..the elevator did not work 3 out of the 7 days i stayed there..horrible service i do not recommend don't go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: SaoPauloTravelagent
Reviews.Content: Since it's a modest low-budget hotel I didn't expect a lot. But it was a lot better than I thought. Room assigned to me was very large, clean and, althought facing the street not noise at all. Continental breakfast included was also alright and finnally location is great! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff makes the Difference in this strategic located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManuelRenero
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 weekends in a row on River Park Hotel during a leisure & business trip and the staff crew trated me really well. Hotel is startegically situated aside the river, walking distance from Brickell Village, where restaurants and bars are amust; Key Brickell, a place for business meetings and jogging on luxury high stylish ambiance. Despite elevator that is really slow or restaurant thas is under development, Front Desk Manager Silveria and Freddy know how to treat and simply upgrading room under availability I have experienced a real big suite with area enough to get back and gather with 4 colleagues. My first weekend was alone and the room was big. Second weekend was even greater. There is a great latin senior guy that helps guiding the in-house taxi wherever you need, who also gave me great recommendations for stylish bar just in front of MortonÂ´s. Access to local bus or metro is very easy, so moving to Ocean Drive is just 20 minutes bus and let you stay back for a complete night life, where the zone is also easy to walk as to skate around. Next time I will definitively repeat and taste new facilities they will have.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only positive”
Reviews.Author: Meador4
Reviews.Content: I didn't think the place could have been as bad as other reviewers were saying, but....it really was that bad!!! The receptionist was unfriendly and could not find our reservation. The place was very filthy and worn out. The bed mattress was the worst part. It was supposed to be a queen size, but was actually a full size instead, and you could feel all the springs when laying on it. The wireless Internet had a weak signal as well as a weak password (I guessed it in one try and easily logged on). Although the place may have once been a nice hotel, it clearly is not currently being managed properly or professionally. The only good thing about this hotel is it's location. We were glad that our stay was only for one night. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: woodworker32
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old, not well maintained, the pool is very small, no restaurants in the suroundings. The employees have difficulty understanding english, when we ask for the minibar, they sent us a small (empty) refrigerator to our room, entering the room while we where asleep. The continental breakfast is very minimal, if you don't like bagels with cream cheese or cereal, you won't be satisfied. The shuttle was included in the price of the room, but we had to pay 6 $ each to get to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel---try to avoid it if you can!!!”
Reviews.Author: zfjlfs
Reviews.Content: This is the most terrible hotel that I stayed in the past few years. 1. The hotel claims free wi-fi access, which actually means wireless is ONLY available in their main lobby (NO internet access of any sort in their rooms). 2. The hotel staff are indifferent and not knowledgeable--I made a reservation for 4 nights stay, the receptionist only gave me 3 nights and was indifferent when I pointed out to her. I had to wait to speak to their manager the following day to get this fixed. 3. To make your stay even worse, their system was not working correctly, such that I had to reactivate my room card EVERYDAY. 4. The breakfast was very limited and what's worse--it was only offered between 8-10AM. 5. Due to all those issues, there is always a long line at the reception desk. Expect a wait!! 6. I have not gone into the rooms themselves yet. The rooms are decent-sized. However, they are not equipped right. For my room, two full bed was placed in a room that is clearly designed for a single queen/king bed--therefore the headboard does not align. The beddings and the towls are of poor quality. In addition, the furniture is outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled - Avoid at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: Brian303
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Park Hotel and Suites in downtown Miami one night prior to boarding a cruise that departed from the nearby port. Chose the hotel because of the location and price, assuming based on website pictures that the hotel would be fine for the one day. I WAS WRONG. Upon checking into the hotel they couldn't find my reservation. Okay, it happens. But the "don't give a crap" attitude of the two front desk agents was extremely rude and frustrating. Further, they proceed to speak to each other in another language in front of my fiance and I for 10 minutes while they shuffle paper around trying to find the reservation. Finally it's found, and we're given a key to the room. We're on vacation, all is forgotten, let's move on. Then we get to the room. The rooms are a joke! All these reviews about mohagany furniture, beautiful bathrooms, etc. is a total scam. The rooms are extremely dated, with very old and beat up furniture, peeling walls, pulled up carpet, and are very poorly lit. The hotel would make a Motel 6 look like a 5-star hotel - I was completely grossed out. Again, the attitude of "it's only one night" took over and we just decided to suck it up and keep our sense of humor. Then we get into bed to find stains on the sheets. Resorted to pulling towels off of the rack and sleeping on top of towels. 6:30am couldn't come early enough so we could get the heck out of there. Slept with one eye on the clock all night, counting the minutes. Finally, the part that really threw me over the ledge, was getting home to find out I've been billed twice (for two seperate amounts??) for the room. So I call, ask for a manager, and a manager never seems to be on duty. I get transfered to a voicemail over and over, and everyone that answers the phone just has a "don't care" attitude. Where are you Toni? I've been told I need to speak to Toni, but I'm starting to wonder if Toni exists? I use TripAdvisor often to get input on trips but have never written a review until now. People absolutely need to be warned to avoid. Multiple other options in the area, and I would strongly suggest you look at all of them before you decide on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: blingbling94
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one weekend night as it was close to the event I was to attend, the first room they gave me smelled like smoke, when I asked for another room they said there wasn't any others and they would spray something, when I went back to the room, nothing was changed, still smelled like smoke and no spray, so I went back and complained some more and they FINALLY gave me another room which wasn't as bad smoke smelling that is. The light bulb was out in the entrance to the room. The heat and/or AC does not work, lucky that it wasn't too hot or too cold the date I stayed. No phone in room. My room was prepaid but they forced me to sign and initial 3 times for the two dollar charge for a SAFE which I told them I wouldn't use, they said everyone pays this charge. Is that legal? I hope some lawyer stays there soon. This hotel barely passes as a real hotel. They keep shoving 3-4 pizza menus under the door at night. No FLAT screen TV here, One night here was enough, the bed and furniture was I think from the 70's. Needs some serious updating.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FROM HELL”
Reviews.Author: nightrider49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived late at night waited 20 minutes while the desk clerk who was not friendly talked to a co worker and ignored that we were even there. As we made our way to the elevator after signing it got worse the smell of smoke and an odour disgusting. The room wasn't any better old carpets and the walls needed a good coat of paint.My wife pulled back the sheets checking for bed bugs. When checking out we were charged for a safe deposit box that we did not use when I questioned the day clerk I was informed that everybody pays whether you use it on not. My advice is check the listing they have another nine hotels in Miami listed under the name of PEGASO HOTELS

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are not true in my humble opinion”
Reviews.Author: romadom
Reviews.Content: I got a frugal expedia plane/hotel package which inclulded this hotel. After reading the reviews on line I was waitting to get rape and pillaged on entering the establishment. Wrong! In short I found the staff helpful, the elevator slightly slow but working. My room was clean and I had a safe for valuables. The doors lock and the tv worked. When I needed my rent a car the valet was always quick to bring my car with smile. It helped that I always bond with hotel staff as I like to talk to them about well anything.There is wifi in the lobby and a computer you can use for free. Yes, I did not dare go in the opaque pool water. The breakfast was not gourmet. In the exercise room only two of the machines worked. But for my medical business purposes , the price was right. The river park is more like a hostel for budget travelers TIP Alert Right up the street was some very good mom and pop latino food places and brand name discount stores. If I had know earlier I would have bought the same t-shirt presents there for 90% less then say a CVS drug store

Reviews.Title: “Dirty slum with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: nativehigh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived for Miamiâ€™s New Years Eve party and we had booked for 2 nights at this old cruddy slum hotel. Which from the outside and lobby appears to be ok. When we arrived I was told they did not have my reservation? What? When I showed my conformation on my blackberry the broken English extremely curt and rude front desk staff said Ok we have it now? When we went to the room it no bull smelled like dirty clothes and you could not find a square foot spot on any wall that did not have dirt or a scuff mark on it in the entire room! ( = room hasnâ€™t been painted for years) We were very upset but we could not find any other hotel on New Year â€™s Eve. So we decided to stick it out. We thought celebrating New Years we would not spend much time in the dirty room. The room seemed a little warm before we left so I lowered the A/C. When we came back to the room from our night the room seemed hotter than when we left. Called the front desk and they sent a staff member (not a maintenance worker) who said that it seemed to be working and would get colder. (bullâ€¦.) After a hour of discomfort and sweating I opened the window which 1 opened half way and the other about three inches and let all downtown traffic noise in. The bed was old, disgusting, with major wear and tear and you could feel and hear every spring. Knowing that our soiled clothes were cleaner than the bed or the old dirty cheapest pillows Iâ€™ve ever seen we used them for our bedding. Very early the next morning after a miserable night we checked out and wanted to cancel our next night that we booked. We were informed that we could not get our money back very rudely and blunt. Instead of blowing a blood vessel I calmly called a booking agent at trip advisor and she was very understanding and called the front desk herself and called me back promptly and advised me that whatever she said got them to credit our credit card for the next night for free. So we could not get out of there fast enough and found a room at a Hilton for $50.00 cheaper than the $250.00 we paid and slept so sound in what seemed to be heaven after such a nightmare in HELL!!! This hotel needs to be sold to someone who cares because these owners obviously do not care about up keep or guest care! I would rather sleep outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “service is dispicable all around”
Reviews.Author: MichCancun
Reviews.Content: We travel to Miami four times a year for fun, we find the shopping to be the best anywhere. We have stayed at the River park before, stayed at Epic next door a few months before, but this time we had arrived from a 15 day cruise from Rome and just wanted a good location and a low price. We brought friends as well. Booked two rooms. Arriving back to the hotel on day 2 late around 8pm we found our door open...the maid had apparently put the latch outside of the door so that she could come back and take out our shopping bags and didn't come back. God knows how long the door was open but we were completely beside ourselves, we had precious purchases from Rome, Toulon and Barcelona that we were not ready to part with. The front desk attendant was not too concerned with our panic and said security would come up. No one came but our friends room was called. As nothing was missing we were able to relax. On check out day, the next day when I was asked for 4usd to cover the use of the safe I looked at the girl surprisingly because I know she knew we were the room with this situation and were they not going to waive this small fee ?? At the least ??? No. she smiled. I told her we manage a hotel in Cancun and if this happened to my guests ?? I would be paying for dinner at the Ritz for them ! I was upset at being treated so poorly and told her I would be writing a review...she told me she had no problem with that. In the restaurant area bagels and orange juice were on display and I said good morning to the lady pouring coffee "how are you today ?" (I can separate the bad service and still be nice to staff not involved) and she looked at me "I'm fine" I think the street person outside had better etiquette than all of the staff inside the hotel.Horribly horribly rude all of them. The maid for leaving our door open all day and worse, the staff reaction to it. Its really too bad because the hotel has a great location but the staff ruin it. We have booked our next trip to Miami at a hotel closer to Bayside and I am sad that River Park has lost our business for good, and the many people we have in the past, recommended

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: meladiction
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Dirty rugs, dirty linens and bathroom. But the worst is, they checked us in a room that was already full. Then, we asked for another room. I also asked to talk with the manager at the front desk and I was called rude. How could we make sure nobody would enter our room at another time? We couldn't so we didn't leave anything in the room the rest of the days. We spent our first night searching for another hotel to switch in the morning but they were all booked. So, all the reviews are true, don't ever stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowtie1
Reviews.Content: My father an I stayed at this hotel on 11/20/10. I the room we had no ice bucket. We called an waited to 45 min to get an ice bucket! In the morning we wanted to turn the heat on to warm up the room. Well the heat didn't work. Next was the shower wouldn't work and we both tried everything for 10 min. As we where checking out of room 1503 another guest was checking out. She said her bath water was dirty coming out of the shower. The guy at the desk we where telling this 2 didn't say a word and charged use full price for the room. Lobby looks nice when you walk in but the rooms are not as good or = to a super8 hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nigthmare”
Reviews.Author: stars56
Reviews.Content: For what they charged, the services should have been better. I couldn't get an ashtray from the people. They were nasty and rude.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY, FAR, FAR AWAY”
Reviews.Author: akuwa
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience, old mattresses, duck taped dresser, difficulty getting clean linen from housekeepers, harassed from front desk staff if requesting clean linen, dirty pool, continual running toilet. Higher priced tours than cruises, unfriendly, unprofessional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this hotel - you might get robbed”
Reviews.Author: Alessandra34
Reviews.Content: I decide to write about this hotel after my colleagues and myself were robbed while in it. They took our laptops, external hard drives, mobile phone and camera chargers, garments, perfumes and even prescription glasses (worth over $3,000). Even though we had read the bad criticism of this hotel here, we decided to stay there since the conference we were attending was next door and we would only use it to sleep at night. Its excellent location in downtown Miami lured us into believing we could put up with the rudeness of the staff hotel, the general uncleaniness and the mildew odour of the room. To cap it all, when we came back from our last night in Miami and found our room was a complete mess. Everything had been moved and our most precious possessions had been taken. When I came downstairs to complain, they did not seem to care and even implied that it could be our fault. They did not want to call the police, but we did it ourselves. It would seem to be an inside job, for the locks were magnetic and the was no way one could open them without a card. I know the price is reasonable for the location, but it's really not worth it. By now, I wish I had read one of the reviews in this site warning that this hotel is not safe. Avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE than expected!! The reviews are true!!!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiJean
Reviews.Content: if you care about yourself or the person you are with do not EVER stay at this hotel!!! you are better off finding a safe place to park you car and sleep in your backseat. speaking of which, upon arriving, there was a customer arguing with the "valet manager" about how someone backed his car into a fence in their "parking lot", he warned us to "dont even give these clowns your keys unless u want your car smashed". the room smelled like pee, looked like rock stars had trashed it the night before and someone had broken in. the staff was RUDE RUDE RUDE and the elevators broken, had to literally wait 30min to go up and down each way from the 11th floor. we were scared to leave anything in the room, and kept our valuables in the glove box of the car, which we parked in the garage of the marriott instead. note- the ONLY reson we unknowingly stayed here for a night was that all else was booked during Ultra Fest weekend. oh yea, the "pool" looks like a dirty bathtub, and the building blocks any sunlight so dont even consider being able to lay out. WORST HOTEL EVER!!! they should demolish it and do mankind a favor.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT”
Reviews.Author: travel23RI
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff is rude - contintental breakfast consists of old croissants they store in large garbage bags and watered down coffee. They double charged my credit card and when I called to speak to a manager to have one of the charges reversed her voice mail was full. Had to call back two more times - first time they didn't answer the phone - second time they put me through to a dummy mail box. Had to fight it through the credit card company as hotel was non responsive. Rate they charge you will change upon check in as they will add for a safe whether you want it or not. Doors have marks on them as if someone had tried to break in in the past. We were afraid to leave our belongings and ended up ordering pizza delivery for dinner. Just stayed here the night before our cruise, but would never stay here again no matter what the cost. Room was old and dirty looking.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay there if you have no other choice”
Reviews.Author: Cheesed
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was disappointing. The location is great if you need to shop in downtown Miami or enjoy the Bay area. The "suite" on the 7th floor was clean but a little shabby. One half of the latch lock on the door was missing so in order to get some sleep I put a chair against the door . The curtains were torn so let the light and the busy street noise into the room. Unable to make international phone calls from the rooms which means that you have to go down to the 2nd floor and use the pay phones and be prepared to have lots of change. And coffee in a plastic cup with a cold croissant while siting at a bar is NOT what I would call a continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: cacherjoe
Reviews.Content: I chose this location thinking all we needed was a place to lay our heads before our upcoming cruise. It was only going to be a night. I should have paid more at one of the neighboring hotels. When we checked in, the young guy working the desk was wearing a hoodie and texting to someone on his phone, yes, while serving us. When we got the check in paperwork we find that in addition to the $89 that was quoted there was an additional $2 for "safe fee". There is a safe in the room so you have to pay extra for that. Room was not clean at all (and I typically have low standards for hotels). There was clothing size stickers stuck to 2 walls in the room. The bathroom was so old, the enamel was gone around the drain in the tub and metal under it was rusted. Only one of the 2 elevators worked and that one made you wait a LONG time. They charged us to hold our luggage after check out. I don't have a huge issue with that, except the guy with the hoodie the night before said there was no charge. The bed was so old, loud and uncomfortable that we got no sleep at all. I would NOT recommend this hotel to even someone I didn't like. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good for overnights and cruises”
Reviews.Author: PedroMelo
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situatted in dowtown miami next to business buildings and luxurius condos. It has very good location to take a cruise ship because itÂ´s hust about 5 minutes from the terminal. and thereÂ´s a shuttle that takes you from the hotel to the terminal for 6 dollars a person. The lobby is well decorated (with a origina Bottero statue....) and confy. We had no problem with the staff that were helpfull in our needs (restaurants, shops, taxis - none of those are close to the hotel, because itÂ´s situated in a business district). we stayed in a room that was small, with used furniture bur confortable. the couch and trapes were used and had some stains... but for one night it was ok! the bathroom was small but with basic amenities, and clean. In the next morning we went to have breakfirst, and were informed that it was only after 8 am ... So we went to the starbuck in the intercontinental 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Overall its a practical hotel for overnights to take a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “heavily infested with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Katrina10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this place for one night only on Jan 31, 2010. Positive: The hotel looks OK, I got a room on 12 th floor ( 1206) with a nice view over canal. The bathroom was updated and clean. The young guy at the reception was very friendly, the lady next to him didn't look that friendly. Location is good, right next to free train. Bad: The breakfast lady is a joke. Older unfriendly Spanish speaking lady, hanging over the counter croissants and muffins. 'Tip' can was there as well. The breakfast itself consist of cup of coffee ( no milk or cream, just whitener) and not fresh croissant and muffin. The biggest problem is that this hotel is heavily infested with bed bugs. The whole place is not cleaned properly. Doors and walls are dirty, carpet is very filthy. I am sure that the linens on my bed was not changed from the previous guest (all wrinkled and hair left ). I could not sleep because of bed bugs. I saw one crawling on the pillow in the morning. It's also a risk to take them home with you. So when I came home I spent hours doing laundry in hot water. If you have to stay in this place, make sure you bag all your clothing before your go to bed, do not leave anything lying around. As I mentioned before, I was bitten badly,not just one or two bites. It means many bed bugs and will be much more.

Reviews.Title: “Dont even consider staying here!!!”
Reviews.Author: vanderstarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the superbowl weekend. ALL of our rooms were broken into along with most of the other rooms in the hotel. People had money, laptops, ipods cameras stolen. Aside from this the rooms smelt, the elevators never worked, the cleaners never gave you fresh towels (even though they took your dirty ones away), and the staff were down right rude! Please don't stay here people. The security is terrible, and the staff didn't seem to care the whole place had been cleaned out!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: braziliandude555
Reviews.Content: checked in with some collegues to the hotel from brazil,elevators no work take long long time.hall ways smells like feet.hotel is really old and will never stay paid 200$ horrible hotel.breakfast only bread and juice staff rude in the morning...

Reviews.Title: “WOULDN'T STAY HERE AGAIN EVEN IF IT WAS THE LAST HOTEL IN MIAMI”
Reviews.Author: NANADEBBIE
Reviews.Content: Staff was very rude, rooms were dirty and run-down, pool was filthy. They advertised a resturant....there was none. No amenities offered that i could find. location close to the port. nothing else good to say. Don't ever stay here. I was injured from a fall in the tub (no slip protection) and was told "you didn't have to stay here". Very poor service from the time we got there until we left. Offered no heat (in January). They charged my credit card in advance for the room instead of waiting until we checked out. Find another hotel when you are in Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a bad experience, really bad service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Julyed
Reviews.Content: It was really dissapointing to find a quite nice hotel in Downtown, selected through a respected mexican Travel Agency (by the way, expensive), which has rude people receiving and giving "service" to travelers. They ask you to pay for everything additional to your payment: for keeping your luggage (1 USD per suitcase) until is the check-in hour (3 pm), por using or not-using security box (2 USD), to give your credit card even if you are going to pay in cash for something additional (but there is no additional to pay). Also, they are rude in telling you everything you ask, and they tell you false information (ex. time for breakfast at 9 am and then when you go down, they tell you it was at 8 am and it was finished, in a rude way). Nobody helps you with your luggage (not so important at this point) and the check-out hour is 11h00!!! Also, shower valves were almost impossible to turn, so we called to reception desk and they told us to turn stronger with a towel!!! they didn't bother to go to our room and do it. I've been in 3star hotels and less in Mexico and nobody is rude with clients, you give tips (even for this amount) but eveybody is gentle and deserves the tip, and check out time is always 12h00, even 13h00!! We stayed just 1 night and the day after we just want to leave the hotel as soon as possible. The first thing I did when I came back to Mexico was to call my agency and send a formal complain about this hotel recommendation, hope they never recommend this hotel again. I hope (for the sake of other travelers from around the world) you can fix this problem, I know all the people staying this same night (from some other countries, also from USA) wanted to complain as well. It's a nice hotel, in a good place and it can be improved a lot just hiring people with "service sense", that's all. I'll pay the same amount of extra-dollars if they treat me like people. Thank you for reading this review. Julieta Rodriguez, Alejandra Zarco and Doria Diaz

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay at this dump.”
Reviews.Author: clionona
Reviews.Content: Everything at this place was horrible. I was treated rudely from the moment that I pulled up in front of the hotel. Every single member of staff from the women who yelled at me to move my car when I pulled up to the valet who didn't want to take my car to the front desk agent who wouldn't even look at me as he checked me in. I wasn't even treated like a human being. As for the building, it was probably once a grand hotel, but now is broken down and in desperate need of refurbishing. In the filthy room, the phone, tv and air-conditioner didn't work. The entire night I was there, I felt unsafe and couldn't sleep a wink. Worst hotel experience of my life and I urge you to never subject yourself to this hellish place. Do yourself a favor - spend the extra money and stay at the Hyatt right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Please do not stay.”
Reviews.Author: Miamisucks
Reviews.Content: Came from Orlando for a Phish show New Years - horrible people (other than fans) way over priced - awful location! We are ashamed to live in the same state as some of these folks. Please spend Your money somewhere else - anywhere! Rude overpriced & downright nasty [--] city!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for pre or post cruise”
Reviews.Author: babsi18
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night there, before my cruise, I was by myself, my friends came in on the day of the cruise. Was not to sure about the hotel, after I saw all the negative reviews on the internet, was thinking about switching hotels, but couldn't find anything even close to the price I was getting at the River Park. Was glad I didn't change, the Hotel worked out great for me. The front desk was nice, they spoke english with me, gave me directions for shopping etc. My room was clean and very spacious, the walls showed some sign of wear, but that didn't bother me, Internet worked great form the Lobby. All in all the Hotel was much better than I expected, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “do yourself a favor and stay at the courtyard marriot right next door!!”
Reviews.Author: tippy505
Reviews.Content: this place is one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed at. The valet ( which is all they had ) was rude and on his phone i had to confront him about taking our car which he could care less about. The front desk wasnt much help either all they said was they are not apart of the motel. The breakfast was 2 small croissants and coffee or orange juice. the pictures must have been taken 15 years ago cause this place really needs up dating.. oh the pool doesnt look like that now and that dinning room doesn't exist anymore.. The rooms were very dingy and i think i got bitten by bed bugs from the bed...the newspapers that they offered were only in Spanish. so stay at your own risk

Reviews.Title: “Will not make this choice if I can afford it”
Reviews.Author: sharkterritory
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here and agree with the hotel staff being impolite and rude. The rooms are not great in any way, but you get what you pay for. I needed a room for 2 weeks and since this was close to the metro-mover and my office, I decided to stay on. It has no facilities for making a cup of coffee and does not have a restaurant. So if you feel hungry, after the complimentary 'Cup of coffee and 2 Croissants' for breakfast, you have to walk down across the street for a snack. In short, a convenient but not comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the pictures fool you! No A/C in 90 degree weather!!”
Reviews.Author: Nichiel
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good online and even the .com booking services will tell you it's a great hotel. Well I know from this that they do not visit the properties that they book for; everything was incorrect! Luckily we were only staying one night; I normally don't allow other people (i'm traveling with) to reserve a hotel for me because I know what I like so I take partial blame for this stay for not doing what I normally do. ANYWAY, we got there and the air in the entire building was not working. And the business that supplied the part that the workers needed closed at 5pm and would not open until the next day. So in Miami we are in 80 to 90 degree weather in a hotel that had NO air. So we complain enough to get upgraded to a suite that no one had used in such a long time that there it was stale smelling on an empty floor and there was no shower curtain in the bathroom. So i had to wait until the housekeepers came to bring a shower curtain to clean up the next morning. (great!) The only plus was the friendliness and courteousness of the night manager, it's located in downtown Miami, $25 away from the airport and they have a van for $6 that takes you to Port to board your ship. Never ever again will let someone pick a hotel for me. This is the second time I've done that and ended up miserable. If you are going to Miami DO NOT stay at this spot, walk up the street to the Hyatt! oh yeah, the continental breakfast consisted of bread and water. (croissants and water) no juice!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for in the end”
Reviews.Author: Suecote
Reviews.Content: I think the negative reviews are grossly exaggerated. Yes the hotel looks a bit old and tired, I had some bleach stains on the carpet in my room, and if you expect to be tended to hand and foot, you should probably choose a 5-star hotel instead. The staff were fine, not your typical plastic fake smiles that American like so much, but very correct in their attention and I certainly would not complain about any staff member. The location is fab, walking distance to downtown shopping, 2 metromover stations, my riverside room was very very quiet and I slept like a baby. Weak coffee and 2 croissants for breakfast, well what would you expect for the price?? There are plenty of places within walking distance where you can pig out on a big breakfast. I stayed at South Beach once, paid twice what I paid at River Park, and the breakfast, cleanliness, and staff attention were no better.

Reviews.Title: “a reasonable deal”
Reviews.Author: HistorianOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: The check in was somewhat slow as there seemed to be some miscommunication between orbitz and the hotel or unfamiliarity among the staff in how to retrieve a reservation placed through orbitz. However, this problem resulted in an upgrade from a room to a suite. The room was old but clean; the edges of the carpeting where meeting the wall were in rough shape. There were stains on the curtains and lamphades. The lighting was not very good for working in. The telephone lacked information how to reach the front desk or place outside calls. These problems aside, the bathroom was in marvelous condition, and the upholstery on the chairs was excellent. This particular room had a view of the expressways and skyscrapers. The noise from the road was not too bad, but, there was some light coming through the curtains which did not fully meet; safety pinning two of them together solved this. During the day it was spectacular to watch the birds glide in circles above the skyscrapers. The other hotel guests were diverse, international, and young. There were some tasty and convenient ethnic restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but extremely bad hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jayakumarr
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 25th July 2009. Got a room in the 10th floor. The view was good and room was clean. Location is awesome. If you do not mind a 15min walk, you can head to Bayside marketplace without paying a penny. We booked through Orbitz and at the counter we were charged an additional $25. We are still trying to figure out what that was for. The TV makes unusual noise after its switched on for 5min. If you accidentally click on a wrong button, the movie or game will get auto ordered and you will end up paying for it. A safe deposit charge is charged whether you use it or not. If you ask any questions to the receptionist, do not expect a polite answer. You might get a question back at you. Here breakfast means "one" small crossaint and a coffee or juice. WiFi works well only in the lobby. Not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here, get the Holiday Inn down the street.”
Reviews.Author: trevdiva
Reviews.Content: Very unclean, couldn't not sleep, they had a hotel cat, and I don't like cats. You get what you pay for, There are other hotels in the area, try those.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuiHungary
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews and it was very difficult to decide if we book this hotel or not, because of the many bad feedbacks. We had to book a room for two nights before our cruise. There were two hotels of which we had to choose. The first hotel was next to the airport and the River Park Hotel which is in the downtown. We chose River Park and we made a good decision. We booked and paid in advance through yahoo.com, we got a very good price, and we had not got any problem at check in. The location of the hotel is perfect in the middle of the downtown, close to the port and next to two metromover stations. The view from the room was great. We booked a room with queen bad and we got a room with hall and with a double king bed. The room was clean, the general condition was OK. The taxi ride from the airport was $27. All lifts were working. The staff was not so helpful and the breakfast was only symbolic, but I would give 4 points of 5. So we would return if we had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: em129230
Reviews.Content: The River Park is conveniently located downtown Miami by 2 different free metromover stations so no car is needed. I received a large sized room for under $70 which included muffins & juice in the morning. The view of the river is magnificent. Wi-fi in the lobby worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, NICE, The other reveiws dont do it justice”
Reviews.Author: borgatabill
Reviews.Content: hotel is very clean, spent extra 10 buck when reserving room due to the scarey feedbacks here. room was very spacious, bathroom was large. all elavators work just fine and were quick, free internet main lobby. it cost me $159 for the room before city taxes. parking is $25 a day, not really any other choices, your in the city where there is basically now parking. parking is done only by valet, I tipped the guy $5 bucks when he took the car and tipped him $5 bucks before he got the car, the car came pretty quick. its about a ten minute walk to the park along the water, very nice, lots of restaurants , stores along a marina, hard rock cafe. walking there it reminded me of philadelphia, but you will be safe there are alot of people. unfortunatly you might see a couple street people too. for the price of this hotel, it was valentines weekend and your in the city the price was excellent, you can do a whole lot worse. i chose this hotel because it is like a mile away for the cruise ship. we were heading out of the port of miami the next day on a 7 day cruise. i recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not a deal at any price!”
Reviews.Author: bogeygolfer326
Reviews.Content: River Park Hotel This hotel needs some serious renovation/refreshment. The furniture is scratched and the couch has multiple holes. The draperies were once beautiful but were falling down in places. The wallpaper is peeling, the walls are crumbling, the dirt and dust bunnies are lurking in every wall/carpet edge and behind doors. There was no list of amenities either in a book or on the tv. I went looking for bed bugs as I fully expected them! The advertised in-room WIFI had been removed and to be replaced sometime? The lobby was the only place for internet service and there was continuous loud pop music playing there. The continental breakfast consisted of ONE multi-day old pastry per person , coffee (no tea) and watered down OJ served at a bar with only two tables for seating. The restaurant was padlocked and the pool was not used making one think there might be a reason for that. The worst part was only one elevator was turned on and it was as much as a ten minute wait in busy times for the elevator. This I think posed a serious hazard for a 16 floor hotel. I would NOT stay here again even if hopping a cruise ship the next day and didnâ€™t care about internet access or breakfast and had already had dinner somewhere before checking in. And even if the price was under$100!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible for downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Genius
Reviews.Content: I made a short stay at the RPH&S in early Dec. Almost didn't given the many neg reviews. However, they also put the place into perspective and lowered any expectations. The place is basic, though in quite a good location. Forget what they refer to as the "complimentary breakfast" as it is weak coffee in a paper cup and a dried out sweet roll. The rooms are aged, though seemingly clean and the TV and a/c worked fine. Previous comments re reception staff are generally correct (they aren't much help at all), apart rom the night manager (on the desk after midnight), who was useful. Given the price (ie if well under USD 100/nite) then it's not a bad option for a sleep and short d'town Miami visit.

Reviews.Title: “ehhh..”
Reviews.Author: jessicabethany
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews of this hotel, and they made me nervous about staying there. We booked it any way, mostly because it was the cheapest we could find. The hotel itself was decent. The staff was nice and they didnt bother us at all. We had to take the stairs up eleven floors beacuse the elevator wouldnt work.. go figure. Later on the elevators worked for us. The room was nice, i was very happy with it. The size was great for us. i dont think i would choose to stay there again... The area the hotel is in is terrible. GHETTO. that ruins it... and parking was either valet- $21 or parking garage- $19. we parked across the street in a parking lot for $10.. but there was no securtiy for our vehicles.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather be homeless”
Reviews.Author: love7761
Reviews.Content: This dump was to be the back up hotel for our convention at the Hyatt. They obviously did not do a site inspection. This place was so bad that I would not even house the homeless. I would not put my worst enemy in this hotel. The first room they gave be had someone else staying in it The front desk staff was half dead with no pulse. There were cats just walking through the lobby. The room was dirty, the bedding and sheets were stained and dirty and the rooms have not been renovated since 1970. I was scared to even sleep in the place or leave any of my belongings. We were here for a convention and many of us checked out hours after we checked in with no where to go. We would have rather slept outside on the street than to have taken the risk of sleeping in that place. The evevator was broken and smelled bad. The management was horrible and did not care nor show any concerned when we complained. IF YOU VALUE YOU LIFE AND BELONGINGS DO NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP. They actually were charging $129.00 per night, I would not have given them 50 cents!. This place is so shady a hooker would not take her clients there. They must have bought the stars that someone gave them. THIS IS A DUMP IN GRAND STYLE!

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason this place is ranked 72/124”
Reviews.Author: JZ20000321456
Reviews.Content: I honestly do not need much to be content, so the fact that I'm reviewing this hotel is notable. First, I will say that it is inexpensive for its location. However, you get what you pay for. These are my gripes: 1. When I visited, which was in early November 2008, one of two elevators was out of order (management didn't bother to place an 'out of order' sign on it). The hotel was busy, and people ended up waiting quite some time for the elevator. 2. As an earlier reviewer mentioned, the wireless internet was not working. I was told by a person at registration that the hotel was switching providers. THEN KEEP THE OLD NETWORK OPERATIONAL WHILE THE NEW ONE IS INSTALLED!!!!!!! The term "seamless transition" is not in the management's vocabulary. 3. I would rate the hotel's breakfast 0/5. Mass-produced muffins and other pastries is what they provided. Luckily, there are some awesome Nicaraguan and Cuban restaurants nearby that you will be happy with. 4. The walls are not necessarily paper thin, but they're not sound proof. If cars are not honking their horns outside your room (which only happened in the early evening) and people in the room next door are having a loud conversation, you can make out every word. Same goes for the television program they are watching. 5. Little thing #1. Fire doors are supposed to automatically close so that, in case of fire, it does not spread. If failure to abide to the fire code is this obvious, I wonder if there are less overt things that need to be brought up to code, like, say, the sprinkler system. 6. Little thing #2. I wanted a particular kind of soft drink, so I found a machine, inserted a dollar, and selected that soft drink. A different brand was dispensed. I went to the registration desk to get a refund, because this is what a person does anywhere else, correct? I was told that I had to contact "the company," referring to the company supplying the drink. I was very surprised by what I was told, so when I asked for "the company's" contact information I was told that that information is not available. This is not a good way to build a reputation for customer service. Overall, I would recommend others to avoid this hotel. As I mentioned, I am not picky at all (despite my ranting here). I just feel that this hotel warrants a review. If you do find yourself here, check out the bar next door - it's owned by an Azerbaijani woman who immigrated 30 years ago who will serve you a cold beer at a fraction of the cost at nearby restaurants/hotels (this River Park place doesn't have a working bar). Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Very Budget but close to the Pier”
Reviews.Author: flightgurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before heading on a Carnival Cruise. We only needed it for one night so we thought we would go budget. The location is very good and they have a shuttle to the pier for $5.00, the rooms are very basic but again you get what you pay for, it's a great hotel for anyone wanting to be close to shopping , restaurants and obviously anyone on a cruise out of Miami Pier. We found it very convient for local shopping and eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommeded”
Reviews.Author: IDTraveler0606
Reviews.Content: My daughter left her laptop comupter when we departed for the Miami port and we discovered it within 30 minutes of leaving the hotel. I called the hotel immediately and they claimed to check the room and said it wasn't there. We know that we were responsible for our belongings; however it was definately in the room and so they obviously have thieves that work there. They didn't show any sense of concern or urgency when I called.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Railroadguy
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay after leaving Orlando, we made the reservations and the staff member(Front Desk) was rude and had no interest whatsoever in me or my reservation there, trying to get information from her was like pulling teeth, but this was my first trip to Miami, and the hotel was downtown so I figured how bad could it be after all the price was right about 100.00 bucks, but I did listen to my instinct and made the reservation for only one night, and booked six nights at the quality Inn at the Falls, the front desk clerk there was great who took my reservation, the River Park when we pulled up looked like a dump in need of some serious renovations, not enough space to pull up to and check in while you take your luggage out of the car, no parking except next door in a office tower (Public ) garage, $21.00 a night, While riding back down in the garage elevator, I noticed a sign that said Hyatt Hotel Guest pay $5.00 a night or something like that, When we checked in at the front dest I asked if they had a similar arrangement with the garage and of course the answer was no. The Girl at the check in desk had no personality and let it be known by her attitude that she was in control, not the customer, the lobby was O.K. but the room was old and outdated, and not the cleanest room I had ever stayed in, much like the Edison Hotel in NYC, I did not feel safe in this hotel, one of only 2 hotels out of Hundreds I have stayed in that I had that feeling, anyhow to make a long story short, I could not wait for checkout the next day for our 20 minute drive to the Quality Inn hotel at the falls outside of Miami on route one, and just as expected from my initial phone conversation with Stanley at that hotel, It was going to be a great stay there, and it was. Stay away from this hotel, if you really need to be downtown stay in a well known chain for a few extra bucks, your peace of mind will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!!!”
Reviews.Author: fritzlam
Reviews.Content: I wish to inform you of the problems encountered with the booking at the River Park Hotel & Suites. After booking on line on January 19, 2008 I phoned to confirm that the rate would be $79:00 per night and because of being allergic to cigarette smoke we would require an non-smoking room and also a room in a quieter area of the hotel. These special requests at this hotel were confirmed by the agent of the online booking company on January 22, 2008. My husband and I checked in at 3:30 P.M. but prior to signing the room agreement I noticed the invoice was for $89:00 per night. Despite seeing the print out of our confirmation from the booking agent,she refused to honour the $79:00 confirmed rate. I insisted that this rate had been posted online and also I had verbal confirmation from the booking agent Joanna, that this would be the rate we would be paying. The receptionist then went to contact the online booking agent's office. After waiting 30 minutes, she returned with a revised invoice with the $79:00 rate, but we did not realize that they had made a change and had moved us from the 6th floor to the 4th floor. When we entered room 410 there was a very strong smell of cigarette smoke. The front room and all the furniture was saturated with cigarette smoke. We quickly closed the connecting door and entered into the bed room. The smell of cigarette smoke was not as overpowering, so we opened the three windows to help air the smoke smell out of the room.
