After having encountered so much difficulty with the front desk, we decided to accept the room, rather than ask them to move us. In the evening we went to close the curtains, but there were no drapes to block out the bright light from the street and the two flood lights mounted on the lower roof of the hotel just below our windows. The room had only a sheer see through curtain and it was as bright as daylight in the room at 10:00 P.M. I phoned the Front Desk and they sent the maintenance man up. He looked at the sheer curtain and how bright and glaring the light was in the room. He attempted to pull the decorative side panel across to cover the sheer curtain covering the large center window but it was impossible. He agreed that this room needed a proper curtain. He would tell the Front Desk and they would move us to another room. Unfortunately there were no other rooms available. We could be moved the next day. In desperation I went down to the Front Desk and requested they lend us two large sheets and I pinned them onto the top of the header of the valance to block out the light. We noticed they did switch off one of the flood lights that was aimed towards our window. The next morning we decided not to request a transfer, because we were afraid we would be placed into another room that was not suitable. We had encountered other problems on the first day, the guest elevator was not working, we had to use the service elevator to get to our floor. The next day maintenance came to fix the guest elevator and then it stopped working again, also the second elevator available to guests also broke down. All the guests in this fully booked hotel had to share the service elevator with housekeeping and the cleaning staff. There was a lot of congestion as guests tried to maneuver their luggage between carts loaded with linen in very narrow passage ways. I am very concerned that the River Park Hotel and Suites does not honour special request of their guests to ensure their health, safety and comfort. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to any of my friends. The Front Desk staff's lack of respect for their guests does not make for an enjoyable stay at this hotel. This hotel should not be recommended by any hotel booking agency because the River Park Hotel and Suites did not comply with the requests of their guests I have attached photographs of the bed sheet we had to adapt to the curtain rod in order to be able to sleep during our two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: PlanesAndTrains011
Reviews.Content: This is the most disgusting, incompetently run hotel I have ever visited. The place was filthy (there was a toilet in the lobby restroom that had gone uncleaned so long that the excrement in the bowl had solidified). The people who work there are rude, uncaring, unhelpful retards. The valet service is so bad we witnessed multiple people whose cars had been lost. The hotel staff recommended a shady, dishonest transportation company that ignored thequoted trip price. And none of the hotelâ€™s phones worked for the 48 hours I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected....”
Reviews.Author: DeeKay02
Reviews.Content: Took my son there for spring break and it was an okay stay. However, it will not be my first choice of hotels if I ever decide to visit the area again. The parking was terrible and is not $19 like the receipt and internet says; it is actually $21 and the man working the front desk became a little upset with me when I brought it to his attention. He even crossed out the original price and put the higher price after I had signed the receipt; which I told him was not good business practices. The toilet did not work; which turned out to be a nightmare for my son who has an intestinal disorder. Our room overlooked the pool and after noticing how unkept it was, we decided against a swim. The telephone did not work, so we had to go downstairs with all of questions/concerns. Even though it was not what I had expected, the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BostonBishop
Reviews.Content: I need very little, it had wifi and a clean room, very spartan furnishings. If you want to go cheap in Miami, this is an option. Helpful front desk when I made a mistake with my reservation. a 1/3 of the price of big name hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Overnight Stay Before a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: vacationmansam
Reviews.Content: My family booked 2 rooms for a 1 night stay before we departed on a cruise. My Brother and his family flew into Ft.Lauderdale and got a private car service down to the hotel. My family flew into Miami and took a taxi. The cab driver found the hotel with no problem. (After reading some of the other reviews, maybe you might mention to the cab drivers that it's the old Clarion downtown, next to the Hyatt.) After reading some of the other reviews, my brother and I were suspicious of what was to come during our stay. My sister in law booked the hotel directly online with them and after seeing some of the pictures and reading the negative reviews, we were seriously planning on cancelling this out and paying big bucks to book another hotel. We decided to gamble and take our chances, as we were only staying for one night. I've been in the travel business (working for airlines and as a travel agent) for more than 20 years and I've stayed at dives before, so we figured what's one night going to do? We arrived around 6:30pm and found the lobby to be filled with a group of approximately 35-50 people. By the time, our luggage was unloaded from the cab, we made our way to the lobby to check in, the group was using the 2 elevators and it took several minutes to wait. The lobby seemed nice and clean, and the front desk staff was friendly to us. We got 2 rooms, one on floor 6 and the second one was direclty above My brother's room on floor 7. Our rooms faced the River and appeared to be clean. We could not find any problems with the room. Sure it was slightly old and worn, but for the price we paid compared to some of the other Miami hotel rates that was quoted to us, again we felt that it would be fine for 1 night. The bathroom appeared clean, and the only complaint was that there were 2 sets of towels, for 3 of us staying in the room. I called to the front desk who said they would send another set up. It took a second call and we received the extra set of towels about 2 hours after checking in. The beds to me were comfortable and I had a good night's sleep. (no bed bugs, or dirty sheets or spreads). Although the Miami River Park Hotel is not a 5 star property, it's not bad for a night or two, and the room rates seemed to be reasonable for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Charm01
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some reviews about this property but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff was not very friendly at first but my hubby made them smile by the time we were checked in. We took the Go Shuttle to this hotel, so we didn't have to worry about a car, which was probably a good thing. There wasn't any rooms ready yet, as we were really early but they locked up our luggage and pointed us in the direction of Biscayne Bay (spelling?) and we were off. We were going to take the free people mover but we decided to walk a bit. It only took us about 10 minutes to walk there using the map the front desk gave us. Very easy. After a couple of hours at the Bay we came back to the front desk, got our luggage and they told us where our room was. A smile must go a long way ( we always say that) because they put us in a suite and it was massive and clean. I'm sure it could have used a little bit of TLC but it was nice just the same. Our window did face the street and it could get noisy but it didn't bother our sleep at all. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant and it was awesome and so was the service. Since we had such great service at dinner we decided to head there for breakfast and we were greeted with the total opposite service. Oh well, what can you do!

Reviews.Title: “Please Do Yourself A Favor & Don't Book This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gooooogirl
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, the valet area did not have sufficient enough space to pull up. There was a line of cars and we sat for over 15 minutes there before the valet came up to us and said that it was $20.00 a night. Checking in wasnâ€™t so bad, the lobby was in desperate need of a remodel. Once I got into the elevator I could tell I had just checked into the â€˜hell hotelâ€™. I should have followed my instincts at that moment and checked into the Hyatt next door right then, but it was just one night for a function and I am a trooper (I really like adventure, but not to this extent). I went to the lounge for a cocktail and there was a boy about 12 sitting at the bar yelling for his poppy in the back of the bar. The pool area was dirty and nobody was there. The elevator was filthy! It smelled like diapers! It had hand prints all over it - looked like that house from â€œBlair Witch Projectâ€�. It was really slow, stopped at every floor and opened its door â€“ the button to close the doors didnâ€™t work. When I finally arrived at Suite 1007, it was fairly a large suite with a front room separate from the bedroom. Looked like the furniture had been there since the 70â€™s. It was mismatched and had cigarette burns. No water view, just a view of the street and the Metro platform which was at eye level and the passengers could see into the suite. It was surface clean, but not clean. It was completely stripped down the mini fridge was no longer in the space it looked like it once occupied. The towels were the size of hand towels. No lotion or condition in the bathroom, just some awful shampoo. There wasnâ€™t even a notepad or phone book or a hotel directory or room service. Not even one of those little signs that say â€˜if you need something let us knowâ€™ because if you did ask for something you already know that you will not get it and that they donâ€™t care. Couldnâ€™t run the air because of the really loud noise that that it made permeated the entire room and it smelled bad. But worst of all the bedâ€¦the bedspread had fresh blood on itâ€¦went on the floor quickly. The springs were poking out, it was uneven and the sheets were horrible and felt like sandpaper on my skin and the pillow was so thin that I had to put both together and had to bunch up the â€˜hand towelsâ€™ in order to make enough pillow just to try to fall asleep, but every time I rolled over it felt like I was getting a rug burn. I went to bed early to wake up early for a function, but never fell asleep because it was so horribly uncomfortable. Not to be melodramatic, but at 3:00 a.m., I thought to myself I should have pitched a tent in the parking garage and slept in a sandpaper sleeping bag, it would have been more comfortable! Tried to watch TV, barely basic cable and most of the stations were in Spanish. I couldnâ€™t wait to leave. When I went to get on the elevator in the morning it was so full, but I was in a hurry and from experience, knew that it would be along time before I got to the lobby â€“ should have taken the stairs in my heels the10 flights down. The elevator went down a floor, stopped of course, opened the door for about 1 minute (60 seconds, no fooling) and then went back up past the floor I got on, stopped for about a minute and then went down, stopped at every floor for about a minute - a real test of my patience. Got to know my fellow guest on the trip down and they had similar experiences, especially with the bed. All this for about $250 a night! This place is poorly managed. I doubt the owner(s) have spent even a night at this hotel. It is a tourist trap! Doubt any of their business comes from repeat guests. What is really sad is the property has great potential, good location, just in desperate need of some attention. This isnâ€™t my first poor experience with hotels in this area, do yourself a favor and stay at a chain that you know has good service while in Miami. PLEASE, PLEASE stay somewhere else besides the River Park Hotel & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Supprise”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandBruce
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed there for two nights ,before a cruise. We used a suttle service from Fort Lauderdale Airport. It was a little hard to find but we were given good service at the front desk and ended up with a suite on one of the upper floors. The rooms were clean, except for the windows(people had finger prints all over). They were large floor to ceiling windows with a lovely view. However the maid lent me some glass cleaner and cloths and I cleaned them myself. The shuttle to the ship went off with no problem for a small fee. It is very easy to go to Bayside Market by foot or metro, the station is right accross the street (no charge) The restaurant in the Hotel is quite nice and the food is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: snutt
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is very run down, my room seemed reasonably clean and the location is good, so I was inclined to give it a decent review. However, on the last night, water started to leak from the bathroom ceiling. I was moved to another room, which turned out the be infested with bed bugs. The next day, I noticed itchy clusters of red bumps on my arms , legs, and shoulders. As someone who had never encountered bed bugs before, I am quite horrified by this experience. I am still itching and worry that I might have brought them home with me. Yuck! Needless to say, I'll carefully inspect any future hotel beds before getting under the covers. And I won't be going back to River Park ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Camera Stolen”
Reviews.Author: keiosakasama
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this was the second time that I was visitng this property. All I needed was a place to crash while my mom and I went shopping. But this trip started off on the wrong foot; first when I got there I asked to leave our bags since we were early for check in and no rooms were ready; so we waited and waited for the bell boy or conceirge or anybody to turn up... After waiting about 10 minutes the manager on duty finally took the bags and gave us a receipt. We went off and returned after check in to be asked "Are you sure you have reservations?" I had all my documentation and yet again I had to wait as the room was not yet ready. Anyways, when we finally got into the room it was not bad.. but could do with a good over hauling and airing out. Anyways, my mom and I went out the next day and when we got back we packed to leave in the morning. When we got to the airport.. the camera could not be found so we thought, maybe we packed it in the suitcase. To date it has not been found and the manager has not returned a call - I have call eight times.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown - Really Rundown”
Reviews.Author: DutchWidow
Reviews.Content: I booked a river view room and was "upgraded" to a one-bedroom suite without a river view. The entire hotel is rundown and years overdue for a remodel. This is not even Motel 6 quality. When I asked about laundry service, I was told there is a laundymat across the bridge in Brickell.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad.”
Reviews.Author: ms-itchyfeet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad. The front desk lady was not friendly when we checked in, but she wasn't rude either. We were early when we cheked-in, so we just waited in the lobby.....half hour later we got the suite for the price of standard room. 8 days later, after our cruise, we came back to this hotel....again...too early to check-in, this time we decided to leave our luggages with the porter and went for breakfast at McDonald's. When we got back, our room was ready. The same front desk lady was there, this time she was really nice and she gave us a suite again for the price of standard. The hotel is old. Decor is outdated, bedding and towels are shabby. Don't eat at the next door restaurant, so overpriced and food is terrible. The good thing about this hotel is the location and price, especially if you stay for a cruise, it is very close from Miami port.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: 2muchtravel100
Reviews.Content: While there, the newspaper carried a story that Miami was ranked #1 in the rudest drivers. This ranking also applies to the front desk. These folks are uncaring and have no hospitality. They just want your money. The hotel is somewhat run down and only 1 of the 2 elevators worked. Faucets leaked and the bedding was old. The room had only 1 bar of soap, so if you wanted to shower or wash your hands at the sink you had to move the soap from place to place. No shampoo, etc. untll the following day. Several others in our group had many complaints from unmade beds to faulty shower curtains. They also stole or trashed a shoe bag I placed next to the dresser (nowhere near any trash cans) and were unconcerned when I reported it to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lovenature
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre-cruise and for the price am very pleased. I had mapped it on Mapquest so had no problem finding it. The front desk agents were very friendly and asked if we needed a resevation for a shuttle the next morning, which was arranged for us. After checking in and unloading our luggage we turned in our Avis car less than a block away and walked back. Our room was a little older but very clean and one of the largest we have ever had without booking a suite. It is located very conveniently to the tram that goes to Bayside and though we did not use the pool or bar, it looked very clean and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: Drivers
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Miami and I hate to say, my WORST hotel stay ever. The hotel is very hard to find. It took us over an hour to locate even though we were less than a mile away from it off the interstate. The only signs on the hotel are the "Ho and Suites" sign that you see light up at night and the small one you see when directly in the luggage drop off area. After we finally found the hotel we were made to pay cash for a $19 a night valet charge. Upon checking in, we were made to give a credit card, although paid in full which I was fine with. Except for the fact that without letting me know it was being done, they put a funds hold on my credit card. The rooms are very cold since they are not carpeted as well as not cleaned well. There was dirt all over the bathroom and in the corners of the bedroom. I can completely see why the rooms are so dirty since after our first night we were not even given maid service until 5pm the next day at which time we refused service since we were getting ready for dinner. When I noticed on the second day of my stay that I had a hold on my credit card the man at the desk, in his broken english, told me that I would have to speak to a manager, whom happens to always be conveniently not available. Upon check out of the hotel I was told that I could not see a manager and the hold on my card would be reversed in 2 to 3 hours. Two days later, since the hold was still on my credit card, I searched and searched for a phone number for the hotel, since if you call 411 the phone number is not listed under anything, called the hotel to again try to speak to a manager or get a corporate phone number. Come to find out the managers are only there Monday through Friday from 9-5 and they are independently owned so you can not call a corporate office for complaints or problems. The one good part of the hotel would be the bartender, he was the ONLY friendly employee.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: screamervh500
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was leaving on a cruise the next day. I consider myself easy to satisfy, and this hotel did not meet my low standards. The walls must have been paper thin because we could hear people in nearby rooms talking all night. The room was nothing special. The carpets were worn and stained. When it came time for checkout we were stranded on our floor because the elevators were constantly packed with people. We literally had to ride the elevator up to get down. No joke, it took us 20 minutes to get down to the lobby. We went down for breakfast and it was horrible. There was 1 employee working and she was doing everything from cooking, to waiting on tables, to working the register. I felt bad for her, but they seriously need to hire some additional help. The food was cold and stale. They were out of cups and plates at the buffet so I had to reuse my plate. The only good things about the hotel were the location on the river (we had a nice view from our room) and the proximity to Bayside and the Port of Miami. Next time I will pay the few extra dollars to stay at a real hotel. 2 thumbs down...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!!! I wouldn't let my dog stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RLLChicago
Reviews.Content: The restaurant was closed, due to "employee problems" for one day. When it did open, the food was burned, has flies and there was no waiters to be found ANYWHERE. After having juice and coffee only, i received no bill and had no waiter, finally went outside to get my car and some lady came running after me and said that I needed to pay. I went back in and had to pay for the entire buffet. $8.95 HORRIBLE!! No internet service for 3 days, I was directed to a 800#, who apologized due to the inability to get through to someone in the hotel who could reset routers for us. And this is no surpise since it was almost impossible for me to talk to any staff in the hotel. Upon requesting to speak to the manager, I was directed to voice mail. Which was promplty ignored and never followed through on. WAIT! IT GETS WORSE!!!!!!!! The bed was 2 box springs, not a box & MATTRESS, (when I complained the security service arrived thinking I had found drugs inside the bed.) - Speaking of beds one floor had loud music, and banging on the walls,at which point I thought it might actually be a pay by the hour hotel. AND THEN, there was the matter of the valet parking, This is a $19 fee to receive parking and valet service. This part was okay, when ther was actually someone around to go get my car. If you are deparate enough to book this hotel, after reading my review, make sure you allow yourself one hour to retrieve your car from valet. Additionally, I got stuck in the elevtor for about 5 minutes one time. Which was no big deal. I was on the fourth floor and figured I would just take the stairs. In the bottom stairwell, There was discarded patio furniture (A LOT OF IT) and I am pretty sure that this is a fire hazard. Overall this hotel was terribly managed, understaffed, the employees were probably underpaid and overworked, communication was minimal at best. I actually felt sorry for the employees who do work here. As for mysle, I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NO Air Conditioning, No Management Attention To It!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lookin&Bookin
Reviews.Content: This place was very hard to find, you would never have stumbled upon it for a nights stay. We finally got in to our room after a long drive and going around the place for about an hour. You have to pay $19.00 per night for Valet parking whether you want it or not. When we got into the room i noticed it was rather warm. I fiddled with every switch on the thermostat but to no avail. Opened the windows and sweated the night in Miami. Next morning we had to get up early but around noon came back for a nap. I called the front desk and was told they would have maintenance check it out After dinner we came back STILL NO AIRCONDITIONING. I sweated all night and woke up every hour until about 4:00 am. At check out i asked if there would be any recompense for no Air Conditioning. I had already retrieved my vehicle. Management did not bother to come out and actually talk to me, but i was offered a free breakfast. Well if i recall, it was an overpriced continental breakfast. Basically i was offered a free jelly roll for having spent two nights in a hot Miami room with the windows open and noisy water traffic outside. Despite my lack of sleep, we did drive safely to our next location. I wrote management suggesting they do something for me, but they gave me a big fat NOTHING. A. someone either, knew it (the Air-Conditioning) was not working and gave me a bad room anyway OR management was ignorant of one of their rooms condition. Then B. when made aware, NOTHING got fixed and NO offers of a working room were made. Then finally C. when asking for some adjustment, I once again got NOTHING in from management. This used to be a Clarion resort and i guess they got smart enough to sell it off. This place has to rely on internet reservations or i doubt anyone would find it. I wrote management and suggested, "make it right" or i'll "write" which is exactly what i am doing. I will never ever consider staying here again, because apparently they just don't care. They got my money and after that i was just out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelpetey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and affordable. The rooms were super big and clean. The outside terrace area is very nice as well as right on the Miami River. Would recommend to anyone visiting miami on a budget who is there for business or would like to stay in the city as opposed to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Below average but okay”
Reviews.Author: avbooks
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for 113 USD, the bathroom is quite nice, the living/bedroom was spacious but worn down. The carpet was filthy, beds were good, the linen clean. Fast wireless Internet. But don't look for any instructions to help you set up your email. The windows are downright dirty, furniture heavily used. For the in-room coffee the coffee pot was missing. All electrical appliances were working. The Valet parking for 19$/day works excellent and is definitely a must. The staff is nice and friendly. For this price you have a bargain location in the middle of Miami and if you are still able to "rough it" a little and if you are willing to overlook some deficiencies, then this is an excellent location for you.

Reviews.Title: “Happily surpirsed!”
Reviews.Author: sueray21
Reviews.Content: I am on a budget so when looking for a hotel my choices were limited as to quality. The reviews I read for this hotel were either really bad or really good so I took a chance and booked it. I am happy to say that the hotel staff were very friendly, the room was clean and hotel is close to shopping and restaurants. The Hyatt is next door so we went there for breakfast one day. I was able to check in at 9:00 am at no extra cost as one review I read had to pay for doing the same. The first room they sent me to had someone already in it so they gave me a suite on the top floor, also at no extra cost. The front desk staff helped us in directions, what buses to take to go into South Beach and were willing to assist us in anyway they could. I would go back again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Im not suprised they lost franchise rights”
Reviews.Author: tripgal288
Reviews.Content: As I said in my title I wasn't suprised to find that this hotel can no longer be considered a Clarion. I actually stayed at this hotel on my honeymoon, but reviews of recent renovations urged me to TRY it out again. The low rates also hooked me. But there is one thing I have learned about vacations in Miami. Cheap never equals "good deal" it equals CRAP and that is exactly what I got the second time we stayed. My husband and myself had brought along my best girlfriend for Ultra Music Festival at Bayfront park. We resereved a room with TWO beds because obviously we weren't all gonna share a bed! When my husband told me we were on the 4th floor and the room number I was praying that we were on the river side because I knew that 4th floor would probably have a view of the roof of the lobby. I was sad to find out that not only did we have a "roof view" room but that they actually had us in a room with ONE DOUBLE BED. Im suprised they could even call that a room! It was a closet with a bathroom. The Double Bed hardly fit in there! My husband got orbitz on the phone immediately and whatever orbitz told them made them change our room. The next room we were given had a river view and two double beds....but it smelled like a gerbil cage! We discovered the problem upon leaving. I checked under the bed for stray socks and discovered several stains that looked like someone had a puppy in there....that explained why there had been a large phone book proping open the room's window. Im almost positive that they gave us an off market room. How nice huh? I took one chance with the pool, my friend and I ran screaming out of the pool when we found a chicken wing bone and other random trash. Sick! There was also some kind of India convention there, and the room next door to us was banging on drums well after midnight. I broke up that party as the hotel staff couldn't be bothered to. The only thing that saves the place from a "terrible" rating is the resturant, the location, and the apperance of the lobby and besides the smell the apperance of the room. It wasn't that bad. The Gnocci at the resturant was great and the drinks at the bar were reasonable. I'll never stay here again. The staff doesn't care about it's guests, and it seems like they aren't committed to fixing problems. I find it saddening to find that people are still complaining about the same things over a year later!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 5 nights using a Swiss travel agent. Just after I booked, a friend of mine told me to look at tripadvisor.com: I saw all the bad reviews but it was too late to change because the travel agent would not reimburse me. I emailed the hotel to make sure my reservation was in their records and to ask a few questions. The answer was quick and friendly. We had no problem during our stay. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. It is not the newest room, that I have ever had but it was fine for us. Only the iron was not functionning, but it was replaced about 5 minutes after we complained. The free wireless internet access was very convenient and the price through the travel agent was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “bad service, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: where do i begin? the valet guy stole my hat from our car, the place stinks, the room was dark, a very scary place to stay and the elevator wasn't working most of the time. we have to take the stairs which had garbage everywhere and a stinky mattress just lying there on the ground. a run-down hotel with poor management and the staff speaking Spanish to tourists like us. hello, we're in America, speak in English!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: amizu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel about a year ago and it stands out in my memory as one of the worst places I have ever stayed. Some lowlights: - room was falling apart and dirty; - vending machines empty on all floors; - computers not working, so had to go next door to the Hyatt and pay a sizable fee to use their computers - dining room smelled musty; - pool had leaves and chairs in it; - was screamed at by an extremely frightening, vulgar man in the elevator, and when reported the event to the front desk, they said they knew him, and did not call the police or take any steps to make me feel better.

Reviews.Title: “still a dump; avoid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of using hotwire which placed me at the clarion. the other reviews below are spot on; from the stained furniture and smell to the elevator which is in severe disrepair. The only positive thing I can say about this place is that they have free wireless internet. I had to laugh when I arrived and the women at the front desk did not have my reservation; i was hoping that they were overbooked so that I could a refund from hotwire; to my disappointment they found a room after fifteen minutes in the back office.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Clarion!!!”
Reviews.Author: j34cha
Reviews.Content: Check-in: There was only one other person in line (we checked in around 9 at night) and the lady processed it fairly quickly. She was polite, and even offered to give me and a friend double beds instead of the original queen bed which i think was more expensive. Staff were friendly. The Elevator: The elevator was slow. There are two elevators for guests to use, but when i was there, the other one was broken so we always had to wait for the one elevator. When we were leaving, I saw somebody fixing the other one. The room: Initally when I went into the room, it stunk a little. But you kind of get use to it. Not sure if all the rooms were like this or not. We turned the AC full blast. It seemed to help. The beds were comfortable and big. Pillows were fluffy. There is no bedside clock for some reason so bring your watch or turn on the t.v. for the time. The room was pretty big! There is a sink outside besides the complimentary coffee maker. THey also provide you with glass cups and disposal cups. There is a working desk and a connection that allows you to have internet setup. They have a sofa. Not sure if it is a sofa bed or not. The bathroom was HUGE. They have the usual tub, sink etc. and lots of space and mirrors. Ice: Personally, i didn't get any ice but the ice machine was broken on the 11th floor i believe. I always saw people retrieving ice. Pool: The pool was outdoor. Didn't swim in it. Location: Clarion is next to the convention centre, and is located across the street from 2 different metromowovers (a free shuttle that transports you within miami downtown). Very convient location if you don't have a car. Within walking distance to bayside or you can take the free shuttle. Noise: Minimal to none. You might occassionally hear a metromowover, but it's nothing to complain of. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody. I gave them 4/5 stars because the elevator issue was sort of annoying but the rooms etc. were great! Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: papaStl
Reviews.Content: 45 minutes to check in, 1 hour wait in the restaurant, furniture built in the early 1900's, smelly, snobby staff (They pretend to not speak English)

Reviews.Title: “Never come back again, NEVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my worse lodging experience ever. I and my friends booked two rooms for the New Year vacation in Miami. First of all, the location of the hotel is not good, right at downtown, there are nothing to visit within walking distance and security is very bad around. Because we had a little bid trouble on the road driving there. We arrived at the hotel around mid-night. After we parked our car in front of the tiny area of the hotel, we went into the lobby to check-in, the black staff was very cold and unfriendly. He checked the computer, said he could only find one room reservation, and the second one was missing. But I did call them and confirmed my reservation after booking it. Then we had to book another one at a much higher price on my creditcard so we can get some sleep that night. The whole building is a mess, very thing is old and stinky. The parking valet guy was very rude and slow. They charge $18/night for that. The room is so small, it is the smallest hotel room I ever seen. The window in my room is not air tight, so it is very cold. But no heat system in the whole building, so i almost caught a cold. Never again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Reserve Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maybe you'll be able to read between the lines (due to TripAdvisor's guidelines). Don't sleep here. $ is not worth it. From the staff to the rooms. Slept in cheaper priced hotels and felt more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the WORST customer service EVER...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I encourage EVERYONE to read this review before booking a room at this hotel. The stay at this hotel started out HORRIBLY, but in the end it was okay. A friend and I had stayed in this hotel in early December for a trip that we had booked on an online booking site over three months in advance. After laughing at the bad reviews I had read on the hotel just days before the trip, we arrived to the hotel around 9:30am. The girl at the front desk was not very welcoming, and nonchalant about everything. The stay started going downhill when they told us to leave our stuff in the storage room and to come back later since check-in wasn't until 11:00am and our room wasn't ready yet. After going to the hotel restaurant to have some of the cold, disgusting "complimentary" breakfast (which in fact was not complimentary at all), we return to the hotel around noon to find a lobby full of different groups of people, which included angry customers at the desk complaining about the customer service. We asked if our room was ready, and the girl at the desk said that it was. About 5 minutes later, she returns to us and says that the hotel was "overbooked" and that they did not have a room for us; however, they were sending everyone that was expecting a room to another hotel in the area, free of charge. They gave us a choice to either wait for a room to become available after 3:00pm or go to the other hotel. When we opted to wait there for a room (since they had confirmed our reservation and room just the day before), the girl at the desk looked as if she were going to laugh in our face. After making several calls about the problem, we returned to the hotel a couple of hours later to see that the lobby was completely empty, and to find that all of a sudden, a room was available. The room wasn't bad at all. It was very clean and well-kept. The only problem was that we received one queen-sized bed when we had requested two double beds. We didn't deal with the staff too much after that, but by the looks of some customer's faces as we passed the front desk, they were also dealing with rude desk attendants and bad customer service. In fact, the only employee that practiced good customer service was the manager of the hotel. If you don't have the patience or tolerance for bad attitudes or service, I would DEFINITELY suggest paying more for a better hotel--such as the Hyatt next door.

Reviews.Title: “This sucked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nobody seems to know what they are doing and they don't care. They screwed up the reservation, tried to charge me when I prepaid and lost my bag the night I was flying home, which they found but have still not sent me 10 days later

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the absolute worse experience I have ever had. Was a quest from Oct. 28-31. Was in town for meeting so I had to endure for three horrible nights. The hotel is filthy and it is need of major renovation. When I ask for the name of the managment company I was refused that information. Once I returned home and tried to get a receipt for my stay I could not get any response. Called 8 times and faxed four times and it is now December 30th and I have still not gotten a receipt.

Reviews.Title: “70's retro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If u like scary movies, its a dream come true. There are mirrors everywhere. But the people were really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Clarion Hotel Sucs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the hotel 12.01 am Monday morning. 05/10/04I had a citizenship to take same morning.. First it started, with the receptionist was looking at me with the expression " what a hell do you want" Then he gave me a room 5 th floor. I asked him to give 2 wakeup calls. I went up to my room lamp was out next to my bed. Then I chkd the phone if it is working or not. " There was no line" telephone was not working in 4 star hotel.!Then I had to go down again ask for another room. he says to me." oh well, it is not connected by us yet! ?? Then I told him give me another room. " he says well it was a suite are u sure you want to change your room" ??? When I am expected to hear " I am sorry mam" we'll get you a better one. Hallo!Then I went to my new room. Such a smal and dirty room. You can see the dust around the bed and also all around the edges of the carpet , within the room..So, I said oh well go to bed because there are only couple of hours left!In the morning I woke up around 6:45 am "not with their wake up call" By chance.! " He forgot to switch the wake up calls to the new room when I got a new room" If I was not going to wake up on time with my will I was going to miss the entire ceremony for my American Citizenship.!!But when I mentioned that he said that he is sorry!What a joke and what a night mere I have had at this hotel. I am a former flight attendant. I had been around the world. But worse comes to worse, I have never seen a disaster hotel I had in my life!.."It was going to cost me my American Citizenship" because they forgot to give me a wakeup call. I 'll never stay in Clarion Hotels period! I 'll never recommend to anyone either! Go to Marriot, Intercontential Sheraton or something, but not this hotel..!
